title: Where do soldiers keep their swords? - Quora

response.answer_text: Swords are only used for ceremonial purposes at this point. For the US NAVY it is an optional part of the uniform for O3 and below. At O4 you are expected to have a sword for those functions that warrant it. That being said, it’s usually in your closet at home, maybe next to your golf clubs, or perhaps in the basement. You will undoubtable never need it if you bring it with you but if you chose to leave it home, you will get picked to do some dumb parade in a foreign port and get stuck needing it. I was told the sword was removed asa required uniform item at the start of WWII to conserve steel. This link below from the US NAVY history page seems to bear that out as well. Swords

Swords are probably kept in their den hanging on a wall or tucked away in a closet with their dress uniform. Even as ceremonial items, they seem to be fading from the picture. I find it a bit ironic that the Navy resurrected the Chief Petty Officer's Cutlass some years after I retired. I'd be curious to know how common they are in the fleet.
At home or at the barracks if they live there. Swords are ceremonial these days.  Some folks even have a nice display rack and put them on the wall
